intro: [WRONG START] Lycianthes armentialis, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, hairy stems, and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, and it is often found in disturbed or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
